subject: Re: [junit] junit reports
msgSnippet: ... Would importing the HTML into Word be good enough? -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com 2005 Gordon Pask
messageBody:
Balraj Goulikar wrote:
> How to get JUnit reports in a word doc? There are html reports produced
> using the foll:
> <target name="testresults" description="Produce a web report of the test
> results (see unittest )"
> depends="unittests">
> <junitreport todir="${reports.webpages}">
> <fileset dir="${reports.junit}">
> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
> </fileset>
> <report format="frames" todir="${reports.webpages}"/>
> </junitreport>
> <echo>Your test results are in the directoty "${reports.junit}"</echo>
> </target>
>
> is there a way to get them as word document reports?

Would importing the HTML into Word be good enough?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
